member.name: M:Articy.Api.ApiSession.ChangeAsset(Articy.Api.ObjectProxy,System.String)
member.summary:
Schedules an re-import of an asset from a new filename (Change asset source).
The methods returns immediately. It just enqueues an job that is processing in the background.
Use when you need the job(s) to be completed before proceeding
member.param: an object proxy whose type is 'Asset'
the full filename of the new asset data to be used
member.exception: ErrorCode.AssetObjectExpected when aAsset is either null or not an asset
ErrorCode.WriteDenied when aAsset is not currently claimed
ErrorCode.AssetFileNotFound when the file specified in the property 'OriginalSource' does not exist.

member.name: M:Articy.Api.ApiSession.CloneChildren(Articy.Api.ObjectProxy,Articy.Api.ObjectProxy)
member.summary: Like CloneObject, but clones all children of aObject instead of just aObject. aObject itself is not cloned. Connections from a child to aObject are not cloned as they cannot necessarily be connected to aParent.
member.param: Object holding the children to copy
Parent to copy the object to
member.returns: aParent

member.name: M:Articy.Api.ApiSession.CloneObject(Articy.Api.ObjectProxy,Articy.Api.ObjectProxy)

member.param: Object to copy

member.returns: The newly created object

member.name: M:Articy.Api.ApiSession.ConnectPins(Articy.Api.ObjectProxy,Articy.Api.ObjectProxy)
member.summary: Creates a connection between two pins. This function will throw an exception if the connection cannot be created, e.g. when the pins are on different hierarchy levels.
member.param: Output pin to start the connection
Input pin to end the connection
member.returns: The newly created connection
member.exception: ObjectNull when a parameter is null
WrongObjectType when a parameter is not a pin or the output/input constraints are not matched
InvalidParentForCreate when a connection is not possible (e.g. different hierarchy levels)

member.name: M:Articy.Api.ApiSession.RefactorVariableReferences(Articy.Api.ObjectProxy,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches expression fields for variable that are named like a certain variable but not actually linked to it. A so called stray variable reference is created when a variable is deleted while still in use by an expression field. When creating a new variable by the same name, that old reference is weak-linked to the new variable by its name. Stray references will not react on renaming or moving unless they are linked to the actual variable by using this function. Expression fields containing such stray variables will be modified and are claimed during the course of this function. Objects in partitions that are claimed by other users will be ignored. The affected partitions will not be unclaimed automatically.
member.param: Variable or VariableSet to refactor
Set to false to modify all usages of aVariableOrSet. Set to true to only modify stray references.
member.returns: list of affected objects

member.name: M:Articy.Api.ApiSession.ReimportAsset(Articy.Api.ObjectProxy)
member.summary:
Schedules an re-import of an asset from its "OriginalSource" filename.
The methods returns immediately. It just enqueues an job that is processing in the background.
Use when you need the job(s) to be completed before proceeding
member.param: an object proxy whose type is 'Asset'
member.exception: ErrorCode.AssetObjectExpected when aAsset is either null or not an asset
ErrorCode.WriteDenied when aAsset is not currently claimed
ErrorCode.AssetFileNotFound when the file specified in the property 'OriginalSource' does not exist.

Defines what to do with the objects passed via aObjects
Set to true to keep partitions claimed after conversion
member.exception: ObjectNotPartitionable is thrown when CanBePartitioned of an object is false
RepartitioningFailed is thrown when the partitioning process failed (e.g. wrong user rights)

member.name: M:Articy.Api.ApiSession.WaitForAssetProcessing(Articy.Api.WaitForAssetProcessingArgs)
member.summary: Blocking call that waits until the asset system has processed all assets. This has to be completed before partitions can be published or the exclusive mode can be left. After claiming a partition, opening a project in exclusive mode and importing assets, the asset system starts checking the status of each corresponding asset.
member.param: an object containing more parameters
member.returns: A boolean indicating if all assets have been processed successfully. Returns false if some asset file is missing in the working copy.

member.name: M:Articy.Api.ApiSession.WaitForAssetProcessing(Articy.Api.WaitForAssetProcessingArgs,System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Blocking call that waits until the asset system has processed all assets. This has to be completed before partitions can be published or the exclusive mode can be left. After claiming a partition, opening a project in exclusive mode and importing assets, the asset system starts checking the status of each corresponding asset.
member.param: an object containing more parameters

If not null, this list gets filled with the full display names of all assets whose working copy file is missing. This can be used to prepare an error message hinting at the assets that hinder the partitions to be unclaimed.
member.returns: A boolean indicating if all assets have been processed successfully. Returns false if some asset file is missing in the working copy.

member.name: T:Articy.Api.OpenProjectArgs
member.summary: This argument object contains all parameters for the method

member.name: P:Articy.Api.OpenProjectArgs.CleanCheckout
member.summary: Default false. When set to true opening the project copies the whole project data to the project folder regardless if it is needed or not. All data in the folder is deleted before the Project folder is used. You might want to make sure you have all necessary files locally before starting an extensive API operation. However this could take more time before the project is ready to be worked with.

member.name: P:Articy.Api.OpenProjectArgs.ForceProjectFolder
member.summary:
Defaults to false. This causes the articy:draft API to use the project folder that was used the last time this project was opened by the current user/machine. This could have also been a GUI rather than an API session.
If this property is set to true however, the project folder of the last opening session is ignored and the project data is copied to the folder specified by the ProjectFolder property in this class.

member.name: P:Articy.Api.OpenProjectArgs.OpenExclusively
member.summary: If false the project is opened in normal mode, if true it is opened in exclusive mode. Implications are the same as when using the GUI of articy:draft.

member.name: P:Articy.Api.OpenProjectArgs.ProjectFolder
member.summary: This is the fully qualified name of the path articy:draft uses as local project folder. All Subersion/Perforce operations exchange data between this local folder and their repository/depot. When a project is opened for the very first time on a computer or with a specific user account a new project folder needs to be specified and the complete project data is download locally.

member.name: P:Articy.Api.OpenProjectArgs.ProjectGuid
member.summary: The Guid of the project to open. This guid can be found in the property sheet of the project node in articy:draft or you can use it from the enumeration method

member.name: P:Articy.Api.OpenProjectArgs.ScmPassword
member.summary: The password of the Subversion/Perforce account that is to be used for opening this project.

member.name: P:Articy.Api.OpenProjectArgs.ScmUsername
member.summary: The username of the Subversion/Perforce account that is to be used for opening this project.

member.summary:
This is a number that defines the save file version of the projects partition files. While this version is displayed in the articy:draft project carousel as text like “ARTICY 1.3” a number is used internally.
The following version number can be found in released versions: - “ARTICY 1.1” -> 24 - “ARTICY 1.2” -> 41 - “ARTICY 1.3” -> 42 - “ARTICY 1.4” -> 45
